snippet: Getting more women to the polls was bound to be good for Democrats, operatives believed. But some are now questioning whether pulling focus away from such issues as jobs and the economy was a good idea.
abstract: Democrats are nervously counting on enduring edge among female voters in most states to prevent Republican rout in Senate elections; some, however, are second-guessing party’s strategy of focusing more on issues like abortion and birth control than on jobs and economy.

byline.contributor: Marjorie Connelly contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Getting more women to the polls was bound to be good for Democrats, operatives believed. But some are now questioning whether pulling focus away from such issues as jobs and the economy was a good idea.

headline.main: Democrats Count on Edge With Women to Limit Election Losses
headline.print_headline: Democrats Count on Edge With Women to Limit Election Losses
